SVGGraphicsElement.summary: The SVGGraphicsElement interface represents SVG elements whose primary purpose is to directly render graphics into a group.

SVGGraphicsElementGetBBox.summary:
The SVGGraphicsElement.getBBox() method allows us to determine
the coordinates of the smallest rectangle in which the object fits. The coordinates
returned are with respect to the current SVG space (after the application of all
geometry attributes on all the elements contained in the target element).

blockquote.para:
getBBox() must return the actual bounding box at
the time the method was calledâ€”even in case the element has not yet been rendered. It
also does not account for any transformation applied to the element or its parents.

getBBox returns different values than
, as the
latter returns value relative to the viewport

SVGGraphicsElementGetBBox.returns:
The returned value is an object, which defines the bounding box.
This value is irrespective of any transformation attribute applied to it or the parent
elements.

SVGGraphicsElementGetCTM.summary: The getCTM() method of the interface represents the matrix that transforms the current element's coordinate system to its SVG viewport's coordinate system.

SVGGraphicsElementGetScreenCTM.summary: The getScreenCTM() method of the interface represents the matrix that transforms the current element's coordinate system to the coordinate system of the SVG viewport for the SVG document fragment.

SVGGraphicsElementRequiredExtensions.summary: The requiredExtensions read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("requiredExtensions")}} attribute of the given element.

SVGGraphicsElementSystemLanguage.summary: The systemLanguage read-only property of the interface reflects the {{SVGAttr("systemLanguage")}} attribute of the given element.

SVGGraphicsElementTransform.summary: The transform read-only property of the interface reflects the computed value of the transform property and its corresponding {{SVGAttr("transform")}} attribute of the given element.
